name: Municipal Fee Assistance Program (MFAP)
description: Provides discounted access to City recreation programs, transit passes, garbage tags, and other municipal services for low-income Kingston residents. Also provides access to partner services like dental care, vision care, and Lionhearts Fresh Food Market discounts.
eligibility: Kingston residents with household income below the Low Income Measure (LIM) + 15% threshold. Must provide proof of income and Kingston residency.
how_to_apply: Visit the Housing & Social Services office at 362 Montreal Street with proof of income (tax return or NOA), government-issued ID, and proof of Kingston residency (utility bill). Application is reviewed on the spot.
cost: Free to apply. Unlocks discounted services.
notes: MFAP card is valid for one year and must be renewed annually. The card unlocks: discounted recreation programs, reduced transit passes, free garbage tags, dental coverage, vision care, and $10 off at Lionhearts Fresh Food Market.
scraped_details: The Municipal Fee Assistance Program (MFAP) is an income-based program. It provides access to our services and programs for free or at a lower cost. We use the Statistics Canada after-tax Low-Income Measure (LIM) plus 15 percent to determine eligibility. LIM thresholds for 2026 Thresholds include additional 15%. 1-person household - $34,793 2-person household - $49,205 3-person household - $60,263 4-person household - $69,587 5-person household - $77,800 6-person household - $85,225 7-person household - $92,054 8-person household - $98,410 9-person household - $104,380 10-person household - $110,020

name: Canadian Dental Care Program (CDCP)
description: Federal program providing free routine dental services for eligible Canadian seniors aged 65 and older with adjusted family net income under $70,000 and no existing private dental insurance.
eligibility: Canadian residents aged 65+, adjusted family net income under $70,000, no private dental insurance. Highest coverage for income under $70,000.
address: Apply by phone or online at canada.ca/dental
how_to_apply: Call 1-833-537-4342 or visit canada.ca/dental. You will need your Social Insurance Number and income information. Service Canada will verify eligibility. Once approved, you receive a letter and can visit any participating dentist.
notes: Covers: routine cleanings, fillings, dentures, X-rays, emergency dental work, oral surgery. Processing takes 4-8 weeks. Many Kingston dentists participate.
scraped_details: Due to the labour disruption at Canada Post, mail correspondence from some programs and services may be impacted. Consult the measures in place during thedisruption of Canada Post services. During this period, some Canadian Dental Care Plan (CDCP) members may receive emails and automated calls from Service Canada with important information regarding their CDCP coverage. Service Canada will never ask you to provide your personal information by text and email. To review your eligibility, visit yourMy Service Canada Account(MSCA) orcontact us.

name: Subsidized Homemaking Services
description: City of Kingston provides subsidized homemaking services through Comfort Keepers Kingston for older adults and people with disabilities who need help maintaining their home.
eligibility: Kingston residents who are older adults or have a disability. Housing and Social Services reviews finances to determine subsidy level.
address: Comfort Keepers Kingston, 12-1786 Bath Road, Kingston, ON
how_to_apply: Contact Comfort Keepers directly at 613-634-2273 or call the City's Housing & Social Services at 613-546-2695. A financial review determines your subsidy level.
cost: Subsidized — cost depends on financial review
notes: Services include: light housekeeping, laundry, meal preparation, grocery shopping, and personal care assistance. Currently has a WAITLIST due to high demand. Apply early.
scraped_details: This program currently has a waitlist. Homemaking services help people who are older, ill or have a disability with tasks so they can remain in their own home. These subsidized services are provided according to rules set by the Province and the City. Homemaking services are managed throughComfort Keepers Kingston. Only residents of the City of Kingston are eligible for this service. Housing and Social Services will review your finances to determine if you're eligible for homemaking assistance.

name: Kingston Transit
description: Kingston Transit operates 45 bus routes with 891 stops across the city. Seniors 65+ receive discounted fares. MFAP cardholders get further reduced transit passes.
eligibility: Open to all. Seniors 65+ get reduced fare. MFAP cardholders get discounted monthly passes.
address: Kingston Transit terminal at Division and Princess Street
how_to_apply: Purchase tickets/passes at the Kingston Transit terminal, City Hall, or select retailers. For senior rates, show government-issued ID with date of birth.
cost: Regular fare: $3.25. Senior fare: $2.25. Monthly pass (senior): $62.00. MFAP monthly pass: reduced rate.
notes: Real-time GTFS data available. Routes run Monday-Saturday approximately 6:00 AM to midnight, with reduced Sunday service. Kingston Access Services provides accessible transportation for those who cannot use regular transit.

name: SPARK Recreation Subsidy
description: Provides up to $300 per year toward registered recreation programs for Kingston residents with low income. Available through MFAP.
eligibility: Kingston residents with an active MFAP card.
how_to_apply: First, obtain an MFAP card. Then register for city recreation programs and the SPARK subsidy will be applied automatically up to $300/year.
cost: Up to $300/year in recreation program subsidies
notes: Covers swimming, fitness classes, arts programs, and other registered city recreation activities. Must have MFAP card first.

name: Kingston Seniors Association
description: Not-for-profit, volunteer-run organization dedicated to keeping Kingston seniors active, involved, connected, and supported. Offers fitness, arts, culture, language classes, recreational activities, and support services including the Home Maintenance and Repair Program.
address: Main: 56 Francis St, Kingston. Also: Seniors Centre St. George's (129 Wellington St), Seniors Centre West (1300 Bath Rd, Unit A-2), Seniors Centre Loyalist (67 Main St, Loyalist)
how_to_apply: Contact the Seniors Association at 613-548-7810, visit any of their centres, or go to seniorskingston.ca.
notes: Celebrating 50th anniversary in 2026. Programs include: computer training, social events, exercise classes, art/craft/culture workshops, fitness and sports, day trips, information and referral services, and the Home Maintenance and Repair Program (minor home repairs for seniors at low cost). Multiple locations across Kingston.

name: Affordable Housing Programs
description: City of Kingston manages social housing waitlist and affordable housing programs including rent-geared-to-income housing, Ontario Renovates (home modifications for seniors and accessibility), and the Housing First program.
eligibility: Kingston residents with low income. Specific criteria vary by program.
how_to_apply: Apply through Housing & Social Services. Social housing has a centralized waitlist. Ontario Renovates has periodic intake windows.
notes: Social housing waitlist can be lengthy (months to years). Ontario Renovates provides grants/loans for home accessibility modifications (ramps, grab bars, stairlifts). Priority given to seniors and those with disabilities.
scraped_details: We offer a variety of housing programs to help residents, such as: Down payment assistance to make home ownership more affordable Grants and forgivable loans available to low-income homeowners to complete urgent repairs or accessibility enhancements Capital funding contributions to building new affordable housing units Forgivable loans to construct an additional residential unit (I.e. secondary suite) on your property

name: Community Centres & Recreation
description: Kingston operates multiple community centres offering programs specifically designed for older adults, including fitness classes, arts programs, social events, and drop-in activities.
eligibility: Open to all Kingston residents. Discounted rates for seniors and MFAP cardholders.
address: Multiple locations: Artillery Park (352 Bagot St), Rideau Heights (85 Maccauley St), Calvin Park (87 Cooke Dr), INVISTA Centre (1350 Gardiners Rd)
how_to_apply: Register online at cityofkingston.ca/recreation or in person at any community centre.
notes: Popular senior programs: aquafit, gentle yoga, pickleball, painting, line dancing, bridge clubs. Many centres also offer free drop-in social hours for seniors.
scraped_details: We offer a variety of programs and activities for everyone. Whether you are interested in special programs, affordable fun, sports, arts, fitness, health, wellness, or community improvement, we have something to offer you. Join us and enjoy the many activities and programs available in our community! OurAccess Without Fear policymeans everyone has access to City services, no matter their immigration status. We will not report a person's immigration status to Canada Border Services or Police. We offer programs specifically tailored for individuals with special needs. Affordable Recreation Program

name: 211 Ontario
description: Free, confidential helpline that connects people to community and social services across Ontario. Available 24/7 by phone, chat, or web. Covers: food banks, mental health, financial assistance, housing, employment, and more.
notes: If you're unsure where to start, 211 is a great first step. Trained specialists can help identify all services you may qualify for.

name: Low-Income Health Benefits
description: Through MFAP, eligible Kingston residents can access dental care, vision care, and prescription drug coverage at reduced or no cost through partner providers.
eligibility: Kingston residents with an active MFAP card
how_to_apply: Obtain an MFAP card first, then access health benefits through approved partner providers.
notes: Covers: basic dental (cleanings, fillings, extractions), eye exams, prescription eyeglasses, and some prescription medications.

name: Lionhearts Fresh Food Market
description: Provides discounted fresh food (produce, dairy, bread, protein) to MFAP cardholders at multiple Kingston locations. $10 discount on purchases.
eligibility: Kingston residents with an active MFAP card
address: Multiple Kingston locations — check website for nearest market day
notes: Markets operate on specific days at different locations. Fresh, high-quality food at affordable prices. Accepting MFAP is automatic — just show your card.

name: Kingston Access Services
description: Specialized accessible transportation service for Kingston residents who cannot use regular Kingston Transit due to a disability.
eligibility: Kingston residents with a disability that prevents use of conventional transit. Requires application and eligibility assessment.
how_to_apply: Complete an application form available from Kingston Transit. An eligibility assessment may be required.
cost: Same fare as regular Kingston Transit
notes: Door-to-door service. Must book rides in advance (at least 24 hours). Available during regular transit hours.

name: Older Adult Services (City of Kingston)
description: City of Kingston hub for older adult programs and support. Covers: tax assistance (Senior Property Tax Credit of $100 for GIS recipients, tax deferral of up to $1,000), home help and maintenance, subsidized homemaking, recreation programs (AquaFit, pickleball, fitness, skating), transit support via Kingston Transit and Access Services, volunteering opportunities, and accessibility resources.
eligibility: Kingston residents aged 65+ (some programs open to 55+). About 21% of Kingston's population is 65 or older.
address: City Hall, 216 Ontario Street, Kingston, ON K7L 2Z3
how_to_apply: Visit cityofkingston.ca/community-supports/older-adult-services or call 613-546-0000. For home help, call Seniors Association at 613-548-7810. Dial 211 for free 24/7 help finding community resources.
notes: Key programs: Senior Property Tax Credit ($100 credit for GIS recipients), Tax Deferral (defer up to $1,000 in property taxes), subsidized homemaking services, recreation programs (AquaFit, open gym, pickleball, fitness/wellness, skating), Kingston Access Services for accessible transit. The city follows an age-friendly initiative aligned with the World Health Organization.

name: Meals on Wheels Kingston
description: Delivers hot, nutritious meals to the homes of seniors and individuals with disabilities in Kingston who have difficulty preparing their own meals.
eligibility: Kingston residents who are homebound or have difficulty preparing meals due to age, illness, or disability.
how_to_apply: Call Victorian Order of Nurses (VON) Kingston at 613-542-7293 to arrange meal delivery.

name: Kingston Caregiver Support
description: Support services for family caregivers of older adults in Kingston, including respite care, support groups, and information. Provided through SE Health and community partners.
eligibility: Family caregivers of older adults or persons with disabilities in Kingston.
how_to_apply: Call SE Health at 613-544-7090 or contact the Alzheimer Society of KFL&A at 613-544-3078.

name: Ontario Senior Homeowners Property Tax Grant
description: Ontario provides a property tax grant of up to $500/year for senior homeowners with low-to-moderate income. Claimed when filing your income tax return.
eligibility: Ontario residents aged 64+ who own their home and have income under $50,000 (single) or $60,000 (couple).
address: Claimed through CRA when filing taxes
how_to_apply: File your annual income tax return and claim the Ontario Senior Homeowners' Property Tax Grant on the ON-BEN form.

name: Ontario Drug Benefit (ODB)
description: Covers most prescription drug costs for Ontario residents aged 65+. Covers over 5,000 drug products. Annual deductible of $100, then co-pay of $6.11 per prescription.
eligibility: Ontario residents aged 65+, or residents of long-term care homes, or recipients of social assistance.
how_to_apply: Automatic enrollment when you turn 65 and have a valid Ontario health card. Present your health card at any pharmacy.
cost: Annual deductible of $100, then $6.11 co-pay per prescription

name: Home and Community Care Support Services (SE Ontario)
description: Coordinates publicly funded home care services in the Kingston region including nursing, personal support, physiotherapy, occupational therapy, and social work. Free for eligible Ontario residents.
eligibility: Ontario residents with a valid health card who need home care services.
how_to_apply: Call 613-544-7090 or ask your doctor for a referral. A care coordinator will assess your needs.

name: Guaranteed Income Supplement (GIS)
description: Monthly non-taxable federal benefit for low-income Old Age Security (OAS) pensioners. Provides up to $1,065/month for single seniors. Automatically assessed when filing taxes.
eligibility: Canadian residents aged 65+ receiving OAS with annual income below $21,624 (single) or combined income below $28,560 (couple).
how_to_apply: Usually automatic if you file your income tax return. If not receiving it, call Service Canada at 1-800-277-9914.
